headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Kom och jobba med oss i vårt CoreOps-team på Svenska Spel! Vi jobbar i till stor del egenutvecklade system och hanterar ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem. Nu behöver vi förstärka med en ny kollega som vill växa och utvecklas med oss. Ta chansen och sök denna tjänst!

Vad kommer du att göra?

Svenska Spels TX-domän ansvarar för Svenska Spels transaktionssystem. Våra system är komplexa och hanterar dagligen miljontals transaktioner vilket ställer stora krav på kvalitet och prestanda. Domänen består av ca 45 personer i rollerna utvecklare, arkitekter, testare, devops och databasspecialister organiserade i ett antal mindre team.

Som DevOps Engineer blir du en del av CoreOps-teamet där du får möjlighet att jobba med utvecklings-, bygg- och deploymentmiljöer för våra transaktionssystem. Vi arbetar med moderna verktyg och teknik i framkant och ger dig möjlighet att arbeta med nya, spännande lösningar varje dag.

I rollen jobbar du och utvecklarna nära tillsammans. Du ansvarar för och assisterar kring releaser av domänens komponenter och levererar dem med övervakning och mätvärden. Du fungerar som bollplank och support vid behov av ny hårdvara, nätuppsättning och brandväggsöppningar i projekt som teamet deltar i.

Är du den som kommer att göra det?

Som person är du självständig, har en stark analys- och problemlösningsförmåga och trivs allra bäst som en del av ett sammansvetsat team. Du är nyfiken och gillar nya utmaningar, speciellt när det kommer till DevOps.

Du har en bred bakgrund som systemutvecklare, systemtekniker eller integrations- och utvecklingsnära testare. Du har djupa kunskaper och flerårig erfarenhet av Linux och har arbetat med orkestreringsverktyg så som Ansible, Puppet eller SaltStack samt scriptspråk som Python eller Bash. Du behärskar svenska flytande i tal och skrift.

Det är meriterande om du tidigare jobbat med transaktionsintensiva system med krav på hög tillgänglighet och har erfarenhet av tekniker och tjänster som MongoDB, ScyllaDB, ELK, Grafana, Prometheus samt Jenkins.

Om Tech på Svenska Spel

På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi är med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tvärtom. Och som ett techbolag som sysslar med spel kommer ett ansvar, både för folks drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Det är också därför du kommer märka att vårt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela företaget från första dagen du börjar jobba hos oss.

Vi är Svenska Spel

Vi är modiga, nyfikna och vi strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör. Vi vill att spel ska vara till glädje för alla - för våra medarbetare, kunder och gäster, för idrotten och för samhället i stort. Vi sponsrar idrottsrörelsen på alla nivåer, förebygger spelproblem och låter vinsten gå tillbaka till samhället.

Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem här:
https://career.svenskaspel.se/pages/formaner

Ansökan och kontaktuppgifter

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering i Solna med möjlighet till flexibelt distansarbete. På Svenska Spel utför vi jobbet där det passar bäst - ibland är det hemma och ibland på kontoret.

Vi utför intervjuer och urval löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Maria Devallius, Chef Core Services, maria.devallius@svenskaspel.se

För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen hittar du information  här (https://career.svenskaspel.se/pages/rekrytering-pa-svenska-spel?utm_campaign=page_130226_cta_4969676&utm_content=https%3A%2F%2Fcareer.svenskaspel.se&utm_medium=cta-block&utm_source=teamtailor-page). Eller så kan du alltid kontakta vårt TA-team på teamta@svenskaspel.se.

LI-HYBRID

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Arelion is a leading light in global connectivity and we've been keeping the world connected for nearly three decades. Today, the world's largest operators, content providers and enterprises rely on our #1 ranked global Internet backbone, AS1299, for their premium data and voice services.

Job description

We are Arelion. You may not have heard of us; though, we are pretty sure you are using our network every day. As a Tier 1 Network provider, operating the most connected Internet backbone on the planet, we are quite passionate about what we do. If you peek under the lid, you’ll find all sorts of passionate geeks within; people who get out of bed each morning because they care for fiber cables, telco housing, routers, wavelength multiplex systems, and, even, software services. The one thing we have in common is our passion for the Internet and our honored customers.

We have taken a hybrid approach when it comes to IT infrastructure. Our applications and software services are running in AWS and our own datacenters located in two major cities in the EU. AWS is our firsthand choice. We apply some of the most modern technologies and concepts in our AWS environment, like IaC using Terraform and Helm to manage our EKS clusters. Automation is key for us, implementing CI/CD mainly using Github actions. Our monitoring solution is based on Datadog.

In order to let the Software Engineers focus on development projects, we are now looking to add two DevOps Engineers. Working with DevOps in the Software Engineering team will allow you to work closely with our Software Engineers and the Infra&Ops team to create and maintain the best possible environment for our applications. You will give us the best possible CI/CD pipeline, service availability, and proactive maintenance by mastering the components in our infrastructure domains. You need to have passion for IaC, Kubernetes, automation, monitoring, alerting, and continuous improvement. We’ll offer the right candidate to chance to work with us in a multi-skilled, cross-border team supporting a multi-national organization with demanding customers. We offer an open environment where you’ll be able to contribute, learn, and grow.

The main responsibilities are:

• Automation of environments, tests, and deployments. 
• Continuous improvements in environments and platforms such as Kubernetes 
• Daily operations of environments and platforms 

The main tasks are:

• Implement and maintain automation of environments, tests, and deployments. 
• Collaborate with Software Engineers to improve and maintain the operating environment for our applications 
• Provide DevOps expertise in development and implementation projects 
• Set up monitoring and logging 
• Troubleshoot issues in applications and environments 
• Automate detection of anomalies and errors in a variety of components involved in our software solutions. 

Skills & Requirements

We believe that you have:

• A degree in computer science or other relevant background 
• At least 5 years of relevant work experience 
• Required skills: 

• 

• • Infrastructure-as-code with Terraform targeting AWS 
• • Github actions 
• • Docker 
• • Kubernetes 
• • Helm 
• • AWS in general and most importantly IAM, EC2, ALB, EKS, RDS, Route53 
• • Bash scripting 
• • Automation tools like chef or puppet 
• • Linux server management 

• Preferred skills: 

• 

• • IT security, such as certificates, cryptography, and authentication/authorization protocols 
• • Logging and monitoring products e.g. ELK or Datadog 
• • Application scaling and high availability 

• Ability to plan your own work and work independently when needed but care about the team 
• A passion to explore and learn more 
• Good social and interpersonal skills 
• We also expect you to be fluent in English, both written and oral 

Your personal characteristics

You have a strong will to contribute to the development projects and to the team output as a whole. You are eager to learn new things and at the same time open to sharing knowledge and experience with your colleagues. Furthermore, you are open to working in a mix of methodologies, nationalities, and cultures. You love technology and doing things hands-on. You aim at delivering high quality output but can at the same time accept that perfection is not always possible to reach.

Our current remote work policy offers the possibility for employees to work from home up to three days per week.

The position is located in Karlstad and is on 100%.

Please hand in your application by using the form below. The selection work takes place on an ongoing basis.

For further questions about the position please contact Sofia Graflund: 070-423 34 23, sofia.graflund@qtym.se

headline: Dynamisk DevOps
description.text:
Vill du ha det bästa av konsult- och produktbranschen och samtidigt tycker DevOps och säkerhet är spännande - då är detta något för dig ! Just nu söker vi på Knowit Secure Solutions en ny medarbetare som vill utvecklas och växa tillsammans med oss. Vi levererar digitala lösningar och bidrar till en hållbar framtid.

Om rollen

På Knowit Secure Solutions utvecklar vi produkter inom säkerhet med våra egna framgångsrika lösningar; SignPort, CDA (Directory Services) samt Governance Platform. Vi växer, får hela tiden nya kunder och därför behöver nu stärka upp teamet med en resurs som ska jobba med DevOps. Du arbetar på något av våra nyrenoverade och centralt belägna kontor i Linköping eller Stockholm (med möjlighet till hybridarbete).

Som DevOpsare hos oss kommer du att arbeta med och orkestrera containrar (Docker och Kubernetes) samt arbeta med CI/CD pipelinedesign. Andra saker du kan förvänta dig att göra är att scripta i t.ex. Python eller Bash samt att deploya i public cloud. Våra produkter levereras antingen som containers eller håller på att migreras till en sådan miljö vilket gör att du får arbeta med flera spännande aspekter i den processen. Vi är ett riktigt erfaret gäng med ett starkt kundfokus och vilja att bli och göra saker bättre.

Om dig

Vi söker dig som tidigare har tagit aktiv del i att bygga och förbättra CI/CD-system och är bekant med en del relaterade praxis såsom provisionering, leveransflöden, byggsystem, repository management, datahantering och datavisualisering. Gissningsvis har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med och orkestrera containrar, CI/CD pipelinedesign, deploya i public cloud samt scriptning. Vi uppskattar att du arbetar bra självständigt men inte heller har något emot att arbeta med kunskapsspridning. Troligen har du en kandidat- eller magisterexamen i datavetenskap eller motsvarande.

För denna roll ser vi att du har god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska i tal och skrift.

Lite kort om oss och vad du kan förvänta dig
Knowit Secure Solutions levererar tre produkter med tillhörande tjänster inom områdena:

- Elektroniska underskrifter (SignPort)

- Identitets och åtkomstkontroll (IAM/CIAM/CDA)

- Riskhantering och regelefterlevnad (Governance Platform)

I våra team stöttar, uppmuntrar och lär vi oss av varandra dagligen. Vi är ett bolag som alltid strävar efter att bli bättre, och det blir vi genom att värdesätta initiativ och ge varje medarbetare chans till att växa hos oss. Något som är lika viktigt för oss är att du som medarbetare har möjlighet till balans i livet genom att kombinera fritid med arbete.

Hos oss värderar vi en fri kultur med nära kontakt med chef och kollegor. Vi erbjuder dig en snabbrörlig, rolig och inspirerande arbetsplats där vi löser svåra problem tillsammans genom att vara ett oslagbart team. Hos oss erbjuds du en trygg anställning med generösa hälso- och friskvårdsbidrag samt pensions- och försäkringsförmåner. Vi jobbar hårt med jämställdhet, miljö och hållbarhet och vi är stolta och glada över att både vara klimatneutrala och det mest jämställda börsnoterade bolaget (https://www.knowit.se/nyheter/knowit-vinner-pris-for-jamstalldhetsarbete/). Vi vill därmed uppmuntra dig som kvinna eller icke-binär att söka tjänsten för att få bli en del av gemenskapen!

Intresserad?
Vi vet att det kan vara svårt att få in känslan i en annons, men tycker du att några av kompetenserna ovan passar in på dig - sök tjänsten idag så berättar vi gärna mer! Kontakta då Mikael Monié på mikael.monie@knowit.se eller +4670 825 96 17.

Vi hoppas höra ifrån dig snart!

headline: DevOps Specialist
description.text:
The Techno Creatives is an inspiring place to work. We design amazing software and hardware solutions for a wide variety of problems. Anything you can think of - we can probably do it. And we probably did. And we got a design award for it. How do we pull it off year after year? It's easy. We care. We have compassion.

Now - caring is not pulling 60 hour weeks. Caring is not tweaking the database communication layer for the last 5% or achieving 100% test coverage. That’s obsessing. We don't do that.

Caring means understanding your users and customers and delivering what they need at a price they expect with a design that blows their mind.

Sounds like a tall order? That you'd have to be a genius? Actually no. You just need to be motivated by compassion. You need to care.

About you and the value you bring
At The Techno Creatives, no one person is one thing. We all have our Majors and Minors. You may be a Major in Android development, but your minors are Web and Unity. Or you're a Major Rust Firmware dev, but you can also do Python.

As a DevOps oriented person, this is second nature to you. You've dabbled in a number of languages across Linux, Mac, and sometimes Windows, as well as whatever runs up there in The Cloud™. You're familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, and maybe even Terraform or Ansible, and you're not scared of shell scripts. Even if you're not that familiar, you're curious and willing to learn - a challenge is fun, after all.

About the job
The Techno Creatives is not the place of work where your job is to mess around with printer drivers and help people out with the WiFi password. We are plenty tech savvy. Your mission is to solve a problem in a way that it stays solved and that others can learn from. That means you’ve been there - you’ve seen things - and now you know what is likely to break.

You will work on new projects. Maybe deploying apps, helping out with CES demos, managing cloud services, tweaking CI/CD flows, setting up new infrastructure, strong-arming grub, updating Kubernetes, helping devs with ops, etc. Any number of things.



Why join The Techno Creatives
All in-house & Diverse of course
An international and interdisciplinary environment with teams working hands on with the development of future products for the world's leading companies. The perfect arena for you who love to learn and get better!

One floor
Studio located in the heart of Gothenburg with a 1500 sqm studio allowing you to be creative. Come visit our magnificent bar/kitchen, for hungry days with the teams and mingle events with our crowd.

Pick our battles
Want to explore a new business area? Learn a new technology? We search for projects within areas that interest us. What interests you?

T-shaped individuals
Curiosity is key, we encourage deep dives into expertise areas that we then share and teach each other through projects and learning sessions.

Agency & Product Company
Opportunity to gain experience in how to build products and companies across different industries. Short-term deliverables and long-term product development, and everything in between.

Soft & Hard
Our work cover hardware, cloud, and software and we have our own E-lab and Makerspace, for making your inventions come alive.

Health & Wealth
Health, wellness, and pension are of course covered by insurance and health care. Sauna and gym, to challenge yourself and dressing rooms with showers and towels to enable your morning run

About The Techno Creatives
The Techno Creatives is a creative tech house using technology in a creative way to solve real and worldly problems that have an impact on people's everyday lives.

We are merging strategy, design, and technology with a mission to be the go-to place for corporates and startups alike that are stuck in discussions, ‘failed already mode’, internal politics, or simply lacking the ‘how to’ skills needed to progress towards their vision.

Our projects span all sectors and corporate types - but we always ensure to maximize the value-add for our clients, be involved early, and take responsibility for solving the real customer problem - not just our assignment. We take pride in finding creative ways to help our clients overcome whatever problems they have within the innovation or digital space.

Recent work includes creating digital experiences for Universeum to help develop the next generations, developing and bringing a Bluetooth-mesh-based lighting solution to market enhancing safety in high-risk industries, creating a connected child seat to prevent abandonment accidents, and a rental service for electric vessels, based on our own IoT platform, making the boating experience accessible by disrupting the ownership model.

With offices in Gothenburg and Shenzhen, covering hardware, cloud, and software we have the ability to take full ownership from initiation to continuous product growth.

headline: Devops engineer
description.text:
We are looking for a DevOps engineer to help us develop and scale our platform, teams and culture leading the way as a first class SaaS company in AdTech!
Why join us?🤔
We live alongside our values of Passion, Collaboration and Challenge; with many events going on at Bannerflow such as padel tournaments, kick-ass inspiration webinars, Friday beers, health month and Level-up Hackathons, there’s something for everyone. As a member of the Bannerflow crew, you will get the opportunity to work with a creative, enabling, and highly advanced product within a 100% cloud-based architecture.
About the role 💼
We are looking for an engineer with previous experience in planning, designing and implementing DevOps processes, strategies and tooling to remove hurdles and pains from product development lifecycles.
As a DevOps engineer you will not only be building cool solutions but you'll also be working side by side with other teams, helping them with their daily challenges. Everything from educating, guiding and collecting feedback to preparing and driving workshops to scale our DevOps mindset and development efficiency. Here are seven insights into your responsibilities:
🔹Plan and implement proactive monitoring for our micro-services
🔹Refine and develop build and release pipelines using yaml
🔹Code and manage infrastructure as code  
🔹Plan and implement strategies for scaling our hosting and infrastructure  
🔹Collaborate with our feature teams to remove pains and optimize infrastructure, code releases and DevOps processes  
🔹Identity and solve performance bottlenecks  
🔹Script and code internal tooling 
As a DevOps engineer you’ll get the chance to have a great impact on where we’re going and how we are getting there.
About you 🙋
In order to succeed in the role as a DevOps engineer we expect you to be a go-getter, have good communication skills, have a scalable mindset and be relentlessly curious. Having the ability to learn as you go while not being afraid of challenges and unknowns is the bread and butter of Bannerflow culture and we'd love to see that spark in you.
Since this team is new, we believe it is important that we as a team have an on-site first approach to work. In order to have direct and clear communications we believe it is important to work closely to the other teams. We would love to see that you have 1 or more years of experience in the following areas: 
✔️ Docker & Linux  
✔️ Azure & Azure DevOps  
✔️ YAML Pipelines  
✔️ Sufficient in either C#, Javascript/Typescript or some other relevant programming language 
Bonus points if you have relevant experience in DSL’s, Kubernetes, AKS, Angular and/or dotnet! ⭐
About Bannerflow 🏢
Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. Each month our platform serves more than 6 billion ads, viewed on 500 million unique devices all over the world. This breaks down to a massive 20 000 requests and 1 GB of data transfer - per second, on average, constantly! To be able to deliver this, we have to stay in the front line of technical development and always keep up with the latest tools and technologies.
We advocate and work along with an agile architecture without hierarchy and bureaucracy where we work in small autonomous and cross-functional feature teams. We are a Creative Management platform that allows companies to focus on being creative rather than spending precious time on repetitive tasks and changing the game by removing the mystery of digital marketing. We simplify complexity, challenge the status quo and as a result we have the happiest customers in the world. 
Application ➡️
The hiring process includes problem-solving, personality, and ability tests. However, our recruitment process is designed to be a two-way conversation. We want to get to know you and we also want to give you a first-hand insight into what it will be like to join Bannerflow. We’re super excited about receiving your application!
We do not accept applications over email, only through this ad. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact the recruiter Mathilda Wahl at mathilda.wahl@bannerflow.com
Screening and interviewing will be held continuously, so make sure not to miss out on this opportunity!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
It’s an exciting time to work at Hive Streaming! In these turbulent times, great employee video communication is crucial for enterprise companies to create engagement and alignment to survive and succeed. At Hive Streaming we are proud to offer an industry-leading solution to this demand. We help multiple Fortune 500 customers analyze, secure, and optimize their video experience on a daily basis.

Hive <3 Sustainable Growth

We have been a hypergrowth company for a long time - more than doubling our revenue every year. For the next phase of our journey, we want to continue that growth by financing it ourselves. By the end of 2022, we will be able to drive additional growth without the need for external capital. This is an exciting thing!

We want to grow sustainably when it comes to revenue when it comes to our people and our customers; they are what truly makes us succeed.

To help our customers to grow sustainably, we will help them by creating alignment and engagement of their employees. We will help them to reduce their carbon footprint through less travel and by increasing the lifespan of their existing infrastructure. All this is at the core of our product, the Hive Video Experience Platform.

The Perks of Working at Hive

🏼 Have it your way! At the office, at home or on the ski slope (did we go too far?) - your way is the best way but flexibility is everyone's way at Hive! We use Microsoft Teams to collaborate, we have digital kick-off's and provide you opportunities to work either remotely or in a hybrid setting.

 Without you = no Hive? We are a fast-paced, global (over 35 nationalities among our 100 co-workers around the globe) scale-up company that empowers every single coworker. Everyone is unique and important for our growth. You will play an important role in the company’s future success.

🏽‍♀️ Flexibility (cannot say it enough)... we have flexible working hours to encourage work-life balance.

 Contribution to innovation and a better world! Hive helps enterprises to communicate through video instead of flying people in from across the globe, which means Hive employees directly contribute to a greener world!

 The boring but most important... salaries are good, insurances are good, awesome health benefits (did someone say free massage at the office?) and hopefully you stay good (& healthy)!

Want to join our journey?

We are growing our Platform team and are now looking for our new DevOps Engineer to our Stockholm office. You will be part of our hybrid workplace, which means you have the opportunity to work remotely and occasionally at our office (to enjoy a free massage, team-building activities, and more).

What is Hive Platform team? 

The Platform team is the backbone of all engineering teams at Hive. Our team of backend, DevOps and cloud engineers takes care of a wide range of tasks that enable other teams to be successful and deliver value to our customers.

The Platform team handles the Azure cloud infrastructure, including things like the Kubernetes cluster that allow other teams to deploy their solutions to our backend. We also provide support to other teams with our backend development framework and supply the best practices and guidelines to serve as base of the development.

Our team is on-call 24/7, which means that we are always on top of any issues and incidents that might occur in the system. Our logging, monitoring and alerting systems allow to tap into the system health and ensure smooth operation for everyone at Hive, as well as our customers and partners.

What will you do?

We are dedicated to provide other engineering teams with a solid foundation for their work. Our scope includes but is not limited to:

- Setting up and maintaining infrastructure

- Monitoring and supporting the system with on-call 24/7

- Developing and maintaining the backend Scala framework

- Providing tools for other engineering teams

- Migrating data to better persistent storage

- Managing access rights and permissions

Who we are looking for!

In order for you to thrive in this role you are experienced with the following technologies and environments:

- Any cloud platform (Azure, Amazon, GCP etc.)
- k8s, helm, containers
- Terraform
- CI/CD and automation
- Willing to be part of on-call
- Networking knowledge (routing, IP-tables, DNS, certificates, etc.)
- Linux


The perfect match will be…

 A problem solver, and a good team player with a hunger for learning new things

 A networker, who's establishing credibility, trust, and influences and collaborates with other functions to deliver results through cross-functional processes

 A good communicator, seeking first to understand and then to be understood

 You are aligned with our Core Values; customer-centricity, innovation, and empowerment.

We hope you are excited about this opportunity and we look forward to your application!





li-hybrid

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Om tjänsten
Som devopsutvecklare på Ticket jobbar du tillsammans med drivna och ödmjuka vinnarskallar i olika produktteam som innefattar utveckling av företagets tjänster. Denna tjänst är till vårat Core-team som ansvarar för utvecklarnas effektivitet! Arbetet innebär att utveckla nya samt förbättra befintliga funktioner och system kopplade till miljöer, centrala funktioner och pipelines för Tickets e-handelsplattform.

Du kommer att jobba i en organisation med korta beslutsvägar och där det går snabbt från beslut till handling. Våra agila team är självgående och utvecklingsgruppen gör själva teknikval och andra viktiga beslut. Dina kollegor här är riktigt skarpa, hjälpsamma, drivna och många har jobbat 10-15 år. Du kommer att få chansen att lära dig och själv sprida kunskap

Teamen arbetar till stor del med open source och driftar även själva molnplatformen. Primärt jobbar Ticket i AWS med Kubernetes, EKS och Jenkins-X med ett grymt CI/CD-flöde. Våra mikrotjänster är byggda i Java, Spring Boot, .Net Core, Python och liknande. Till detta använder vi även RDS, RabbitMQ, Firehose, Athena, Glue, ELK, Prometheus, Sagemaker, Neo4j, Terraform med mera.

Till vardags kommer du att skapa nya funktioner i vår grundplatform så att våra utvecklare har en enkel och effektiv miljö att bygga funktioner på. Du är med i processen från skapande av story till att produktionssätta den. Vi hjälper också gärna våra team i funktionella diskussioner och våra utvecklare med kompetens om Kubernetes, pipelines och AWS. Teamen väljer själva vem som gör vad så det finns bra möjligheter att själv välja inriktning och utvecklas.

Om dig
Du har en examen inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, civilingenjör eller motsvarande utbildning, alternativt längre erfarenhet av utvecklingsarbete på professionell nivå. Minst fyra års erfarenhet av utveckling och några års erfarenhet av Kubernetes. Du får gärna ha en bred erfarenhet av techspråk och miljöer, men meriterande med Java, Go, EKS, Jenkins-X. Du kan bygga effektiva och skalbara system och vill gärna jobba i team och agera bollplank till andra. Hos oss får du stora möjligheter att leda och driva utvecklingen i våra miljöer. Som person uppskattar du att utmanas av nya tekniker och tycker kod är kul! Du gillar dessutom att arbeta agilt och triggas av snabba förändringar som kan uppstå genom de korta beslutsprocesserna. Som person är du kommunikativ, driven och har hjärtat på rätta stället!  Du har grundläggande kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift

Om Ticket
Ticket är idag den största privatresebyråkedjan i Norden med sajterna Ticket och Airngo, över 400 medarbetare och sina 68 butiker i Sverige och Norge. Vi har stark tillväxt och gör det med marknadsledande lönsamhet

Vi bygger och driftar själva vår e-handelsplatform med alltifrån utmanande backendfrågor inom skalning till att sortera hotell efter sannolikhet till köp. Ticket sitter i toppmoderna lokaler i Sickla, några minuter från Slussen. Här jobbar ca 80 personer med allt från sälj, utveckling, marknadsföring till ekonomi och personal. För Tickets anställda finns parkering utanför kontoret. Vi har även kontor i centrala Göteborg för den som trivs bättre på västkusten. Givetvis har du sex veckors semster, flex så vardagen fungerar, en del arbete hemifrån, full tjänstepension enligt ITP och trevliga reseförmåner.

headline: DevOps Developer
DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Are you tired of working in monotonous environments? Do you want to build a strong resume with advanced technologies and well-known companies? We are the answer! At SwedQ, the employee is always the priority, we listen to your preferences when it comes to your career path - Do you want to be certificated in AWS? We provide it. Do you want to build your own Team? Do it. Do you want to become a Solution Architect in the future? Let's achieve your goals together by designing a role that fits you, your wishes are our law.

SwedQ is a consulting company that works towards becoming the first choice within development and digitalization through delivering tangible results based on our clients conditions and business objectives. We accomplish this by focusing on the Know-how, experience and right competence.

What's in it for you?

As a DevOps engineer with SwedQ you will get exposed to bleeding edge technologies, varying environments and challenges each day. We are hiring before having an assignment, we design the role together based on your preferences and experience. Our assignments and solutions are provided throughout all types of industries, but our main focus is within the IT sector. For now, our consultants are working on everything from implementing a new architecture of a cloud solution, to helping to set up the new back end system for autonomous vehicles.

Our clients

The limit is infinite. We work with smaller fintech companies to the more known companies in Sweden. Currently our consultants is working with: Spotify, H&M, Scania, Ericsson, Schibsted among many others.

You will bring:

- Minimum 3 years of experience working with DevOps.

- Strong analytical / problem solving skills
- Good communicator
- Fluent English
- Experience in designing and working with cloud infrastructure.
- Experience from building data pipelines in a cloud environment.
- Good knowledge of at least one programming language.
- Good knowledge in AWS, Azure or GCP.
- Experience with modern way of working: Microservices, serverless frameworks, Containerisation (Docker and Orchestration with kubernetes)


SwedQ culture

Our culture is very, very important to us, we value low hierarchy, independence and responsibility, value-creating work and having fun together. We believe in diversity and equal opportunity. At SwedQ we want you to be yourself and we value the differences in people, come to the office in flip flops or high heels, as long as you feel comfortable.

We believe in having fun and making memories, to maintain that we do a lot of activities such as playing football tournaments, going on trips and organising dinners.

Perks & Benefits

- Competitive salary

- Flexible working hours
- Budget to spend on health and gym
- Generous developers budget
- Fully paid relocation package - Work permit, flying tickets & the service to find apartment.
- Monthly payments into you additional pension fund
- Health insurance
- Office in the City - Stone's throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
- Support for open source projects and community engagements

- Developers time, to use during work hours for your personal growth
- Kick-ass colleagues and mentors at every corner


Other information about the employment

- Start - Immediately / as soon as possible

- Employment - Full time
- Location - Stockholm


Since SwedQ is one of the natural fastest growing consultancy companies in Sweden, we will always be looking to recruit more people. Make sure to get in contact with us to learn more about us and our clients. We always looking forward to establish a future relationship.

headline: Devops Engineer till DevOps & Application Technology
description.text:
DevOps & Application Technology är en central funktion inom Business Technology SE och ett av våra 3 CoE:er (Centers or Excellence). Inom funktionen ger vi support och stöd gällande metod, process, verktyg och teknologi till våra agila utvecklingsteam för att möjliggöra effektiva och säkra agila releaser och skapa värde för våra kunder och vår affär. Vi söker nu flera DevOps Engineers till funktionen!

Om tjänsten

Som Devops Engineer arbetar du med vår toolstack för CI/CD inklusive vårt code repo och vår SDLC-process. Du tillhandahåller support till de agila utvecklingsteamen och hjälper till med onboarding samt uppsättning av pipelines och konfigurationer. Du arbetar med förbättringar i verktygen och att titta framåt mot nya lösningar.

Vår funktion tillhandahåller support till 40+ agila team fördelade både inom Business Technology och utanför. Den tekniska miljön är fokuserad kring microsofts teknologier men vi kommer framöver också täcka CI/CD och support för vår mainframemiljö.

Du kommer ingå i ett team - Dev Support, där arbetet bedrivs agilt med gemensam backlog. Samarbete såväl inom DevOps & Application Technology som med de övriga funktionerna inom Business Technology SE är en naturlig del i arbetet.

Tjänsten är placerad i Malmö eller Stockholm.

Du rapporterar till Head of DevOps & Application Technology.

Din profil

För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du har:

- relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom Data/IT eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet

- erfarenhet av CI/CD och SDLC och ett intresse av området

Det är meriterande om du har:

- kunskap inom Azure DevOps Server, JFrog Artifactory, SonarCube och Jenkins

- kunskap inom Microsofts utvecklingsteknologier

Vi samarbetar skandinaviskt, en del kollegor finner du i Norge och Danmark. Vi har också en del indiska partners. Att förstå svenska, danska och norska underlättar men är inget krav. Att tala och skriva på engelska är naturligt för dig.

Som person är du engagerad och nyfiken på nya teknologier eller att fördjupa dig i befintliga och har en förmåga att blicka framåt. Du trivs med att arbeta i komplexa miljöer och att arbeta agilt är naturligt för dig. Du eftersträvar ständiga förbättringar och gillar att vara den som hjälper till att lösa problem och ge den support som efterfrågas och behövs.

Då vår funktion inom DevOps & Application Technology är ett av våra centrala CoE är det viktigt att du vågar framföra dina åsikter och deltaga i diskussioner. Vi som funktion finns till för att hela tiden förbättra det levererade värdet i våra agila team mot vår affär och våra kunder och för det behövs delaktighet och inspel från alla i teamet. De bästa lösningarna tar vi fram tillsammans som team!

Vad vi erbjuder dig

Området, liksom många andra områden inom IT, genomgår förändringar. Både gällande de teknologier som erbjuds och etableras men också i vår organisation där vi tar en plats inom Tryg där samarbetsformer utvecklas bl.a. inom Trygs C4E funktioner (Center for Enablement). Funktionen DevOps & Appliction Technology och i synnerhet Dev Support teamet är i en uppskalningsfas där vi ska bli flertalet nya medarbetare under 2023. Du kommer erbjudas kompetensutveckling och lära känna flera nya duktiga kollegor!

I tillägg till det ovanstående finns det många karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom Trygg-Hansa och det är du själv, i mångt och mycket, som driver din egen utveckling framåt genom att ta egna initiativ.

Hos oss är alla viktiga och vi inser betydelsen av att vara en inkluderande arbetsplats. Vi är stolta över att ha en hög arbetsglädje där våra medarbetares kompetens och engagemang hör till våra absoluta styrkor.

Ansökan

Välkommen med din ansökan via länken nedan. Då urvalet sker löpande ser vi gärna att du inkommer med din ansökan snarast möjligt.

Vid frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Daniel Thulin på 070-168 23 55 eller via mail daniel (mailto:marie.hicks@trygghansa.se)thulin@trygghansa.se.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Fackliga representanter

Akademikerföreningen: Lena Darin, 0701-68 28 44
Forena: Elias Bakk, 0707-30 68 54

Om oss
Trygg-Hansa har gjort skillnad i människors liv sedan 1828 och är i dag en del av Tryg-koncernen, Skandinaviens största sakförsäkringsbolag. Som medarbetare på Trygg-Hansa arbetar du tillsammans med 7 500 engagerade kollegor över hela Tryg-koncernen i Sverige, Norge och Danmark. Tillsammans arbetar vi varje dag för att skapa trygghet för våra kunder med utgångspunkt i livbojen, vårt ikoniska varumärke. Våra kompetenta och engagerade medarbetare är en våra absoluta styrkor och vi är stolta över de fina resultaten i våra medarbetarundersökningar. Som medarbetare hos oss har du många karriärs- och utvecklingsmöjligheter både på Trygg-Hansa och inom hela Tryg-koncernen. Genom att ta ansvar och visa tillit till dina kollegor driver du tillsammans våra engagerade ledare din egen utveckling framåt. Hos oss är alla lika viktiga och vi arbetar aktivt för att skapa en inkluderande arbetsplats.

På Trygg-Hansa har vi god kunskap om vad våra kunder råkar ut för och vad som skapar oro och osäkerhet. Den kunskapen använder vi för att förebygga skador i livets alla skeden. Vi erbjuder mer än bara försäkringar. Vår ikoniska livboj finns sedan 1959 utplacerad vid cirka 80 000 vattennära platser över hela landet och sedan många år bidrar vi till Svenska Livräddningssällskapets sommarsimskolor. Som engagerad partner till Avicii Arena och med vår utbildning ”För alla unga” arbetar vi aktivt med att förebygga psykisk ohälsa. För oss är det här några exempel på hur vi bidrar till en tryggare framtid och ett hållbart samhälle.

Läs mer om Trygg-Hansa (https://www.trygghansa.se/)

Följ oss gärna på Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/TryggHansa/) och Linkedin (https://www.linkedin.com/company/trygg-hansa)

https://www.trygghansa.se/om-trygghansa/jobb-och-karriar/lediga-jobb)

LI-SG1

headline: OSS DevOps Engineer
description.text:
About this opportunity
Dedicated Network is a segment of Business Area Enterprise Wireless Solutions (BEWS) which ventures well beyond the traditional boundaries of Ericsson’s core business. Demonstrating growth within global connectivity management, connected vehicles, industrial site connectivity, data, and network insights and security automation, we build customer and enterprise value. We are bold, making calculated bets on the future and working with us means you will be a pioneer – shaping the future for us, and Ericsson. The team has a key role in putting connectivity in a box, creating dedicated networks for our customers, enabling connectivity in mines, airports, ports and more. Our product called Ericsson Private 5G (EP5G) is taking the world by storm. We have a huge focus on UX, putting that on the fore front of everything that we do.
 
What you will do
You will be responsible for our cloud-based micro service OSS system called Ericsson Network Manager (ENM) that is deployed on several clouds around the world serving enterprise customers. Your team will be involved in developing new features to satisfy the needs of our Enterprise customers. You will also be working with our talented development teams on the system integration between ENM and our EP5G product and troubleshoot issues whenever they arise.
Some tasks of the team include (not limited to) Integration, tool- and automation development, process and method development, test and verification.
 
You will bring
Experience with Google Cloud (Strong cloud understanding)
Good knowledge of Kubernetes, Jenkins
Solid and extensive Linux experience
Strong network understanding
Scripting and automation experience
Strong debugging, troubleshooting experience

 
Also good to have
OSS Domain Expertise and system tuning and performance
Rosetta or Terraform experience
Creating/updating their own MOPs
Experience from large customer integration projects
Preferred at least 3 years developer experience
Experience from test and verification

 
We highly value your curiosity and willingness to learn!
 
Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity! The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
 
What happens once you apply?
Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
 
Application:
We look forward to receiving your application in English. Please note we cannot accept applications via email.
 
Primary location for this role: Goteborg, Sweden
 
For specific questions please contact Recruiter: Monika Jasinska monika.jasinska@ericsson.com
 
We welcome the opportunity to meet you!
 
 
Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.
Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || Sweden : Västra Götaland : Göteborg 
Req ID: 717066

headline: Business Analyst DevOps
description.text:
We are looking for a Business Analyst for our client in the area of aftermarket.
In the role as a Business Analyst, you will be involved in development and maintenance of diagnostic service based systems and tools supporting the aftermarket needs. Your responsibility is to identify and define the solutions that will maximize the value delivered to stakeholders. All work is done in agile teams in iterative collaboration with other specialists. 
Duties: 
As a BA you are need to understand the business and system requirements and gather input from stakeholders that need to be involved in the project. You are responsible for the planning, organizing, reporting and following up the requirement activities in accordance with the development processes. You need to ensure that the requirements are correctly understood by the team. You provide support for prioritization of scope and communication channels for end users. You facilitate the collaboration within the agile team, when it comes to requirement breakdown, solution architect work, coding and testing.
 Skills/Experience required:
 •      A Master or Bachelor degree in Engineering, preferably Electrical Engineering, Physics Engineering or Mechatronics/Automation Engineering, or Computer Science. 
 •      Good knowledge about electronics and embedded SW development
 •      Basic knowledge of the Vector tools; CANoe and CANalyzer
 •      Good knowledge in Python and DevOps
 •      Good knowledge in agile SW development way of working including CI/CD 
•      Good understanding of: HTML5, CSS3, javascript, GraphQL, Restful services,  Containers, Azure Cloud
•      SAFe and ISTQB certificate is a plus
•      Excellent English both spoken and written
•      Used to working in a multi-cultural environment 
Additional info:
We schedule interviews on a rolling basis so do not wait until end date.

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Build your future with Sovos.
If you are looking for an opportunity where career-minded professionals can achieve success while bringing their best and whole selves to work each day, Sovos may be the company you have been looking for. Employees at Sovos operate on the leading edge of digital technology while working to improve lives and the communities in which we live and work. When we say Solve Tax for Good, we mean For Good in every sense of the word. Our organizational commitment is to provide a place where employees can thrive and progress in their careers while having the support behind them that only a global company can offer.
Sound like this might be the opportunity you have been looking for?
Take a look at our career posting below. Don’t check all the boxes? Apply anyway! We are focused on hiring the right people, not the “right” CV.
It’s not about what you have done somewhere else, it’s all about what you are capable of doing here.
The Work You’ll Do:
Using the latest technologies such as Azure DevOps, Terraform, Kubernetes, the Senior Dev Ops Engineer works closely with Agile Development teams and SaaS Operations department to understand, analyze, and design quality technical solutions that support our Agile Software Development Life Cycle model. The Senior Dev Ops Engineer will design and implement multiple applications build, release, deployment, and configuration activities.
More specifically, you will:
As part of a Sovos Platform Team, responsible for design & implementation of cloud environments to engineering teams, also responsible for driving DevOps, SecOps (shifting security left in lifecycle), SRE practices.
Build & Implement the baseline, building blocks for different cloud services, security, automated pipelines, monitoring, logging, and observability of cloud platform.
Design and implement the lifecycle of common Cloud, DevOps and Security tools used in software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Coaching engineering teams with best practices and ways of working in Cloud, adopting DevOps & Security practices, running Kubernetes clusters, data & analytics, machine learning workloads in the cloud.
Collaborate with software engineers and product owners in achieving the best cloud development experience for engineering teams.

What We Need From You:
Proven Experience in working with AWS services and delivering Cloud solutions at scale
Proven Experience in Infrastructure as Code using for example Terraform, Puppet or Cloud Formation
Experience in using one or more scripting languages
Strong experience with CI/CD technologies, for example Azure DevOps, TeamCity or Octopus Deploy
Knowledge in networking and related services such as DNS, Load balancing, CDN etc.
Working experience of message queue technologies is highly valuable (RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc)
Fluent in English

What Does Sovos Offer You?
The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work
Continuing opportunities for further Learning & Development
Progressive Wellness Program
A chance to work with talented and passionate people in a rewarding and values-driven environment!
Visit our careers page to learn more!

Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work
Company Background
Sovos was built to solve the complexities of the digital transformation of tax, with complete, connected offerings for tax determination, continuous transaction controls, tax reporting and more. Sovos customers include half the Fortune 500, as well as businesses of every size operating in more than 70 countries. The company’s SaaS products and proprietary Sovos S1 Platform integrate with a wide variety of business applications and government compliance processes. Sovos has employees throughout the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter
Öppen för alla
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We are now looking for profiles with 5+ years who have good hands on working experience in Automotive domain in CI/CD pipelines. We have a close collaboration with a number of market-leading local companies. Here you get the opportunity to be a part of one.

We would like you to have:


• Programing Languages: C++, C, Matlab, Python
• CI/CD:  Jenkins, JFrog Artifactory, Docker,Kubernetes
• Software Configuration Management Tools: GIT, Gerrit, Gitlab/Github, JIRA
• Automotive Process Standards: ASPICE, ISO26262 System Safety
• Methods: AI, Machine learning,  Agile
• Cloud Competence: AWS or Azure

Nexer as an employer 
At Nexer, we think that every new idea, every innovation and new acquaintance is a promise of a better future. For you, for our customers and for the world we live in.

The future is not a distant dream, it is created by the actions we do today. At Nexer, you get the opportunity to dream big, think smart and make sure things really happen. We take visionary ideas and create concrete strategies. We use technology as a tool for progress and find new ways to communicate.

We work value-driven and put our heart into everything we do. You get close to those who make decisions and you can always be involved and influence. If you work at Nexer, you get a strong employer with an international presence and great opportunities to develop.

Application
Welcome to submit your application below. We accept applications on an ongoing basis. If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact the responsible recruiter Sugandh Agarwal at sugandh.agarwal@nexergroup.com

More about Nexer 

We lead the change and constantly strive to find new technical solutions. If there is a smarter way to do something, we will find it. We challenge ourselves every day to think outside the box and help our customers to always be one step ahead. Services in digitization, IT and R&D provide increased customer value and growth for organizations in both the Swedish and global markets. We have also been named Microsoft Country Partner of the Year in Sweden and Brazil - twice.

Our great community involvement in Star for Life, My Life, Pink Programming and the Code Center also gives you as an employee the opportunity to make a real difference.

Nexer is entrepreneurial and has over 1500 experts in strategy, technology and communication. We are located in nine countries and in more than 20 locations in Sweden. Nexer is part of the Danir Group and was previously called Sigma IT.

headline: DevOps Engineer Stockholm
description.text:
Brinner du för den senaste tekniken, har en bakgrund inom systemutvecking och samtidigt tycker att det är viktigt att ha att ha kul på jobbet? Då är ALTEN något för dig.

Varje medarbetare är lika viktig i ALTENs framgång! Vi tror på att växa tillsammans genom att erbjuda möjligheter, utveckling och gemenskap. ALTEN verkar inom flera olika branscher, har en stor variation av uppdrag, coachande chefer och utbildning via ALTEN Academy vilket gör att det alltid kommer vara möjligt att utvecklas hos oss. Dina önskemål styr din väg framåt.  

Som konsult får du både en teamkänsla i ditt uppdrag och en riktigt härlig gemenskap på ALTEN. Genom våra interna nätverk såsom Women@ALTEN och ALTEN Sports ges du möjlighet att driva frågor och aktiviteter som just du brinner för. På ALTEN tycker vi det är viktigt med balans mellan arbete och fritid, därför erbjuder vi tre extra lediga dagar per år. Hos oss är du ansluten till kollektivavtal och erbjuds förmåner så som friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och försäkringar. 


ÄR DU DEN VI SÖKER? 

Vi söker just nu efter skickliga Devops Engineers till vårt IT-team i Stockholm. För att passa i vårt team ser vi att du är en lagspelare och en öppensinnad problemlösare – ivrig att lära dig och tycker om att dela din kunskap med dina kollegor.

Krav för tjänsten:
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av DevOps
CI/CD och Microservices
Docker/Kubernetes
Cloud (Microsoft Azure eller AWS)

Meriterande är om du även har erfarenhet av Python, Bash, Go, Git, Jenkins eller Gerrit. Vi värderar samarbete, kreativitet och kontinuerligt lärande. Har du en positiv attityd och en vilja att lära? Då vill vi höra från dig!

Har du några frågor mejla Josefin Sjödin, Talent Acquisition Partner IT på josefin.sjoedin@alten.se

OM ALTEN

ALTEN är ett av Europas största teknik- och IT-konsultföretag med över 45 000 anställda i mer än 30 länder. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och mycket tekniska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan hos de främsta företagen inom flera olika branscher såsom Fordon, Telecom, Industri, Energi, Flyg och Försvar samt Life Science. I Sverige är vi över 1300 engagerade medarbetare med 11 kontor i 10 städer - från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr.  

ALTEN har för fjärde året i rad utsetts till en av Sveriges attraktivaste arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen 2023, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.  

Välkommen in att läsa mer om oss på alten.se

headline: Senior DevOps engineer
description.text:
Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.
With international calling, money transfers, mobile top-up service and more we design products with the needs of modern migrants in mind.
Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.
Rebtel is looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer
About Rebtel’s infrastructure
Our infrastructure is entirely cloud-based and we have components in the 3 major cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP). Our infrastructure hosts our customer-facing business applications as well as support systems used internally by different teams. Given how long we have been around, we have some legacy applications and systems that run on VMs in the cloud, but our preference is for containerization orchestrated by Kubernetes.
In an environment as vast as Rebtel’s, it is important to maintain thorough documentation of our systems, but even better to persist our infrastructure as code using modern tools such as Terraform. Our work approach is well structured without being stifling. We use an agile workflow to handle day to day tasks. We strongly encourage collaboration as an excellent way to spread knowledge and to deliver universally relevant products and services.
Given our fast-paced journey and market ambition, you will find tasks that are demanding and that will trigger your creativity. At Rebtel, everyone contributes to our customer propositions - we have quick communication channels between teams and have regular hackathons to respond to opportunities and challenges as they come.
Rebtel is looking for a DevOps and Infrastructure engineer to join its team that is building new products and services in a modern, cloud-based ecosystem.
About you and your responsibilities

We’re looking for an individual who we can learn from and help us take our infrastructure to the next level.
We love to share the knowledge we have and to learn new things from you.
You have keen interest in architecture: how to build complex systems that are maintainable.
As an Infrastructure and devops engineer, your role will include actively contributing towards architectural decisions. You will discuss technical solutions with the rest of the team and act as an inspiration to improve and maintain system stability, availability, and security.
You are interested in problem solving and enjoy finding the simplest possible solution to complex problems.
You work well with teams, even in areas besides DevOps and infrastructure, but are also capable of performing as a sole contributor in your area

Requirements

Experience with Azure and, preferably, also with GCP and AWS.
Good understanding of security in the Devops area.
Experience setting up CI/CD pipelines using common tools deployment tools (GIT, Azure Devops, Teamcity, Octopus)
Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform and Ansible
Sound knowledge of networking principles and common concepts such as firewalls, load balancers and application gateways and debugging tools such as Wireshark.
Good understanding of containerization using Docker, Kubernetes and Helm charts
Experience with system administration on both Windows and *nix based platforms including scripting using Powershell and Shell.
Excellent communication skills in English

Bonus points

Knowledge of IP telephony and related technologies/protocols such as SIP, WebRTC.
Experience writing and automating system tests as well as incorporating them into CI/CD pipelines
Experience working with cross functional teams on mature products with many users
Experience working with standards for compliance in the payments industry e.g PCI

Ideal candidate

3+ years full-time professional experience (i.e., 6k+ hours)
Committed to documenting and automating routine tasks
Raise the level of everyone around you
Happy hacking on new technology, loves R&D
Always curious, always learning
Vision for product development and for how a code base evolves
A pleasure to work with

 
We are Rebtel - People from all around the world, as of now 23, countries and more to come. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
&nbsp

headline: Salesforce DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Ready to join our Digital Transformation?


We are looking for a Salesforce DevOps Engineer with at least 2 years experience of handling Salesforce releases, joining our Salesforce Chapter Europe team of specialists, supporting a wide variety of product teams to deploy and operate the releases in our Salesforce pipelines.
You are a self-motivated professional who likes to take responsibility, come up with ideas of improvements, and collaborating closely with stakeholders, developers, and architects during our Salesforce release phases.
You also have a customer-first mindset and is ready to challenge the status quo and an ability to solve complex problems and think out of the box.


Your typical tasks include
Deploy custom Salesforce applications using the Copado platform utilizing several Salesforce products, such as Sales Cloud, Experience Cloud, Commerce Cloud and help to achieve the business goals by releasing with quality and on time.
Lead the work, aligning different product teams to perform synchronized releases into a common Salesforce production org.
Work in a team centric environment where a culture of innovation allows your input and ideas to become part of the solution.
Develop plan for delivering on commitments, and then execute on those plans following agile methodologies.
Sharing of information and learnings, all while working in a fast-paced environment



About you - must have
In depth knowledge of the Salesforce platform and what variants of metadata might be deployed.
Experience and ability of using different release strategies and pipeline setups, and knowledge of choosing the best solution for a particular situation.
Experience using GIT and resolving merge conflicts.
Familiar with using Apex (classes and triggers), Visualforce, Lightning pages, Aura Components and Lightning Web Components.
Deep knowledge of Salesforce development best practices and frameworks
Attained at least 2 relevant Salesforce certifications as a minimum
Ability to collaborate effectively with team members in different geographies.
Excellent written (Business & Technical), verbal and listening communication skills.
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.



Good to have
Proficiency of using Copado as a release management tool
Copado certifications
Experience with test automation
Experience developing using Salesforce B2B Commerce for Visualforce or B2B Commerce on Lightning
Education
A Bachelor of Science or Master of Science degree in Computer Science, Engineering science, Information Technology, or other equivalent/related programs.



What’s in it for you?
Possibility to upskill, attend trainings and take certifications
Volvo benefits, for example a yearly company bonus
Collaborate with like minded people, enthusiastic about the Salesforce platform
A high performing team and a positive atmosphere where mistakes are welcome as part of the learning
Exciting business solutions you’ll help to release, collaborating with Volvo CE, Volvo Trucks as well as other divisions of the Volvo Group
A challenging environment where 2 days never look the same
Salary to be negotiated depending on experience and skill sets



Contact us!
Herou, Henrik +46 700838805


Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.

headline: Ledare inom DevOps
description.text:
Hej,
Jag heter Mikael Zöögling och är affärsägare för DevOps erbjudandet på Sopra Steria. Det är ett strategiskt viktigt område för oss och vi ser en stor efterfrågan på våra tjänster.

Jag söker nu dig som vill vara med och leda och fortsätta växa teamet framåt. Vill du ha en ledande roll på ett högprioriterat område? Vill du arbeta med teknik i den absoluta framkanten? Gillar du att utvecklas tillsammans med kunniga kollegor på utmanande uppdrag? Vill du få chansen att göra verklig samhällsnytta hos några av Sveriges största bolag? Då är denna möjlighet något för dig!

Jag vågar lova dig en omväxlande vardag och otroliga kollegor, på en arbetsplats där trivsel är en strategisk prioritering. Just därför är vi så grymt stolta över att Great Place to Work har utsett oss till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2022. Vi lever efter vårt motto 'Tillsammans når vi längre' och det speglar sig i allt vi gör i vardagen, från kompetensutveckling, i kundleverans och till sociala aktiviteter. Tillsammans skapar vi en kultur där vi alla ska trivas och vilja utvecklas under lång tid.

Om tjänsten

Tjänsten innebär att i rollen som Personnel Manager (PM) ansvara för ett team på 5-10 medarbetare parallellt som du arbetar som konsult på max 80%. Rollen är bred och omväxlande där ditt uppdrag blir att leda och inspirera ditt team till nya mål parallellt som du själv utvecklas genom egna konsultuppdrag. Konsultuppdraget kan till exempel vara som DevOps engineer, SRE, eller i roller som DevOps strateg, beroende på vad du vill utvecklas inom. Dina dagar kommer dessutom att innehålla aktiviteter inom rekrytering, sälj, marknad samt affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling. Med rollen följer också en också en plats I Quality Solutions svenska ledningsgrupp.

Vi satsar på kompetensutveckling - det innebär bland annat att alla ledare hos oss får genomgå ledarskapsutbildningar för att få underlag att vara bra ledare samt möjligheter att certifiera sig inom relevanta områden. Vi är övertygade om att när individen växer så växer bolaget.

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig vi dig som redan har hunnit inhämta relevant erfarenhet att använda dig av. Sannolikt har du: 

• Tidigare erfarenhet av ledarskap, i leveranser eller av kollegor. 
• Jobbat hands on med DevOps tekniker, så som containers, orkestrering, infrastructure as code, administration av servrar, automation, CI/CD, monitorering och loggning. 

Det viktigaste är dock att du trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med duktiga och teknikintresserade kollegor samt att du fortfarande är nyfiken på nya verktyg och på att fortsätta utvecklas. Som ledare förväntar vi oss givetvis att du delar med dig av din kunskap har en passion för att se människor växa!

Svenska och engelska på professionell nivå behövs för den här tjänsten.

Ansökan

Nu vill vi gärna höra lite om dig! Ansök enkelt genom att antingen ladda upp ditt CV eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto via annonsen på vår hemsida! Om det fortfarande finns något du funderar över är du välkommen att kontakta Mikael Zöögling: mikael.zoogling@soprasteria.com

Vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer och tillsätter tjänsten så snart vi hittar rätt kandidat. Skicka därför gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

Vi ser fram emot att få höra ifrån dig!
