headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Why Lifesum is your next career move

Hi, this is us!

Lifesum is the world’s leading nutrition platform. We help over 55M users around the world improve their lives through healthier eating. Headquartered in Stockholm, we’re a global team of passionate entrepreneurial individuals, working together to build something that truly matters.

We want you to share our excitement about the future
Today the global wellness market is valued at $1.5 trillion, and a third of consumers are expected to increase their usage of nutrition apps, diet programs, and subscription food services this year.

Our technology team works to ensure that this is all possible. We want you to bring your expertise as you will have a great impact on how the platform team works and how we build things - for example building scalable microservices, new infrastructure, making architectural decisions, database designs, and working with test-driven development. We know you can learn things from us, as well as we want you teach us things we don’t know.

You should be able to work independently as a subject matter expert. Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer, the Senior DevOps Engineer is a key position that acts as the bridge between the technology and product to the global markets we serve. As such the new Senior DevOps Engineer will have a pivotal impact on the development building of the leading global platform for Healthy Eating, Simplified.



Your experience will be a valuable asset


- You want to be part of developing and evolving the best nutrition platform in the world

- You always strive to do better and learn new things

- You have extensive hands-on experience and knowledge of development, both from an architectural perspective and hands-on development

- You have many (8+) years DevOps & Developer experience

- You have experience in creating and maintaining complex cloud infrastructure

- You have past experience building scalable microservices, AWS, Kubernetes, Testable code, Event-Driven Development (Queues/Messages/Streams), Python, database design, and software architecture

- Knowledgeable in multiple programming languages including go

- Experience writing and designing microservices

- Experience working with systems with millions of users

- Experience working with different NoSQL databases

We offer

- Trust and responsibility in a fast-paced environment

- Opportunity to work on a range of exciting projects with many of the most successful companies in the world

- Space and support to develop and grow your own career

- 30 paid vacation days per year

- Parental pay

- Pension

- Private health and medical insurance

- Individual training and development budget

- Referral bonus

- Wellness allowance

- Flexible work

- Great team activities

We are just getting started
At Lifesum we also not only embrace diversity, but we rely on it to succeed. That’s why we work hard to ensure our team, vendors, and partners are representative of the millions of users we serve.

If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you and get to know you. Send us your resume right away; tell us why you are interested and why Lifesum feels like your next career move. Everyone is welcome; we look forward to your application!

headline: AWS DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Company Description
Devoteam A Cloud Sweden is the most recent addition to the Swedish Devoteam family. We specialize in bringing together and growing AWS expertise - we’re a team of curious, bold and brilliant people. At A Cloud, we combine startup flexibility and creativity with the operational and capital support of an enterprise. At Devoteam we collaborate with our customers in finding the next innovative solution that will support the customer to achieve better business results.
We always base our advice and implementations on proven best practices. Working as our customers’ trusted architects, we secure the platform for the future and provide solutions to support their business demands. We work agile with prototyping to show early effects and opportunities.
We specialize in Edge Computing including IoT, Serverless, Data Streaming and Analytics, Modernization & Migration as well as Security. 
Job Description
We are seeking a skilled DevOps engineer to join our delivery team. In this role you will work closely with software engineers and other team members to design, implement and maintain infrastructure and automation solutions on the AWS platform. You will be responsible for building and managing AWS environments, CI/CD pipelines, automating infrastructure deployments and ensuring the observability, reliability and scalability of the solutions. 
Key responsibilities:
Design and implement infrastructure automation solutions on AWS
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines
Collaborate with software developers to automate application deployment and infrastructure management
Monitor and optimize system performance and capacity using observability tools
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in production environments
Continuously improve processes and practices to increase efficiency and reliability

This is a hands-on role and will require a great deal of “can-do” attitude!
We have a hybrid office working model and like to occasionally meet the clients’ team at their offices.
Qualifications
We believe that you are open-minded to new ideas and flexible when meeting new challenges to succeed in this role. You have the ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively to deliver on time and with quality. You enjoy collaborating and are comfortable sharing your knowledge with your colleagues and clients.
Key requirements:
You have been working at least 3 years on the AWS platform.
Proficiency with AWS, including strong experience with Terraform.
Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as Python or Go.
Strong understanding of CI/CD concepts and best practices, with experience using tools such as Jenkins, Github Actions and CircleCI.
Good understanding of observability and used tools such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana or Datadog.
BS in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience.

You are fluent in English on a professional level in order to communicate with various stakeholders, both technical- and business-oriented. 
 
Additional Information
At Devoteam Stockholm you get:
Challenging and rewarding assignments; many of them end-to-end
Wellness grants for sports activities (5000 SEK/year)
Passionate and skilled colleagues 
Human-centric and value-based culture
Variety of social events

About Devoteam A Cloud 
Devoteam A Cloud is a Premier Partner to AWS with 4 competencies, 400+ AWS certified experts and 700+ certifications. In 2020, Devoteam A Cloud trained over 1000+ people.
At Devoteam, we deliver innovative technology consulting for businesses. As a pure player for Digital Transformation of large organizations across EMEA, our 10000+ professionals are dedicated to ensuring our clients win their digital battles. With a unique transformation DNA, we connect business and technology. Present in over 20 countries in Europe and the Middle East, and drawing on more than 20 years of experience, we shape Technology for People, so it creates value for our clients, for our partners and for our employees. Our mission is to build cultures of innovation at companies by transforming the way they work and by elevating their customer experiences.
We are looking for people with big ambitions, who want to grow with us and help companies build a culture of innovation with AWS solutions.
At Devoteam, we share our knowledge, learn from each other and from other experts by giving or listening to talks, participating in Hackathons, taking hands-on classes and getting certified. 


A fair chance.
Devoteam is open to applications from all sections of society. We believe diverse teams help us make better products. We welcome all people regardless of age, gender, experience and background. 
If you can see yourself in this role and feel you can bring value and a unique perspective to Devoteam, we encourage you to send us your application - even if you do not necessarily meet all the above requirements.
We apply continuous recruitment, so make sure to send in your application as soon as possible, given that Devoteam A Cloud’s recruitment process allows us to hire someone else before the last application day.

headline: DBA / Devops
description.text:
Önskar du också att du kunnat säga att du var med i Spotifys linda, eller att du bidragit till koden bakom PayPal? Nu har du chansen. Vi har tekniken. Vill du vara med och demokratisera den tillsammans med oss?
Nu söker vi DBA / Devops-medarbetare till vårt utvecklingsteam i Halmstad och vill gärna träffa dig som:
Är mycket bekväm i linuxmiljö.
Har djupa kunskaper kring databaser och har stenkoll på hur saker som index, kluster och replikering används och fungerar under huven.
Har erfarenhet av att bygga, underhålla och vidareutveckla server- och nätverkslösningar samt brinner för att skapa och optimera lösningar tillsammans med övriga i utvecklingsavdelningen.
Är bekväm både i eget och andras cloud.
Har god erfarenhet av installation och konfiguration av mjukvara relaterat till webbtjänster, såsom webbservrar, DNS, lastbalanserare, databaser etc.
Löser problem med kod
Har väldigt goda kunskaper i såväl svenska som engelska i både tal och skrift. All kommunikation och dokumentation sker på de språken.

Det är meriterande om du även:
Har arbetat med programmering, särskilt i PHP samt PHP-ramverk, särskilt Laravel
Har relevant erfarenhet inom NoSQL-databaser
Har relevant erfarenhet av machine learning / AI.
Erfarenhet i HTML, javascript och CSS

Utöver dina professionella kvaliteter värdesätter vi att du
Är lösningsorienterad och driven
Har god samarbetsförmåga och värderar teamets gemensamma mål
Är öppen för att prova på nya tekniker och lämnar alltid koden i ett bättre skick än du fann den

Du erbjuds 
Möjlighet att vara delaktig i en spännande resa på ett växande techbolag 

En flexibel och trivsam arbetsplats på ett modernt kontor som är något alldeles extra, med allt från spelhörnor till loungeavdelning 
Effektify är en plattform för att effektivisera företags marknadsföring.
Nu går vi in i en mycket spännande fas för att vidareutveckla, skala upp och samtidigt lansera fler spännande tjänster i vår plattform. Därför söker vi nu dig som intresserad av att utmana, utveckla och ser nya förbättrade lösningar för framtiden tillsammans med vårt utvecklingsteam!
Bakgrund
Bolaget grundades våren 2021 och har huvudkontor centralt i Halmstad. Vi har idag även ett nyöppnat kontor i Berlin och totalt är vi 22 personer.
Effektify består av två affärsområden där den ena delen är utveckling och den andra delen består av vår konsultverksamhet med specialister och experter inom analys, strategi och drift av digital marknadsföring.
 Övrig information om tjänsten
Start: Enligt överenskommelse
Omfattning: Heltid
Placering: Centrala Halmstad

Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals- och intervju fasen.
Skicka din ansökan tillsammans med ditt CV till jobs@effektify.com
För mer information om alla våra lediga tjänster gå till https://effektify.com/karriar/

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
About us
doWhile is a company that strives to give its employees the creative freedom to explore new ideas and innovations that make an impact on the world. We achieve this by building products with high quality and high value for our customers, and by constantly learning through collaboration with our customers.


doWhile develops high-end CI/CD solution products and also offers software development at customer sites (CI/CD, automotive, telecom, game development etc). We are searching for great developers.


doWhile was founded in 2017 by a group of talented and driven software professionals and engineers and we are 40+ employees today. We believe that with talented individuals, who have the support and backing from the whole group, we can achieve great things together.
Your role
As a senior DevOps engineer at doWhile you will work with our clients to build high-quality infrastructure and solutions using modern technologies and methods.
Responsibilities
Build mission-critical high-quality infrastructure. 
Build infrastructure and integration components that follow industry-standard design patterns, development methodologies, and deployment methods. 
Take part in system architecture discussions. 
Provide technical leadership. 
Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders throughout the development process. 
Help clients transform into using DevOps best practices and methodology to increase quality and speed up deliveries.





Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, math, scientific or technical discipline. 
Passionate and fluent in Linux, computer networks, container technology, and cloud infrastructure 
2+ years of experience in software development.  
4+ years of experience in DevOps 
Interest and ability to learn new technologies as needed.

Preferred Qualifications  
Deep understanding of cloud computing; virtualization, hosted services, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems, and content delivery networks. 
Deep understanding of testing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment. 
Experience with networking technologies, load balancers, firewalls, API proxies, and web security mechanisms, and virtual network functions. 
Experience with deployment and orchestration technologies such as Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, etc. 
Experience with Continuous Integration orchestration technologies like Jenkins, Bamboo, Gitlab CI, SonarQube, artifact management tools, License and security scanning tools, etc. 
Professional experience with multiple programming languages such as Java, C#, C++, Python, GO, and Lua. 
Experience with database systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Cassandra 
Experience in system administration tasks in Linux, Unix, or Windows 
Experience with IT security practices such as encryption, certificates, public key infrastructure, etc. 
Ability to work independently and in a team. 
Interest and ability to learn new technologies and programming languages as needed. 

What we offer
An environment with great colleagues who support each other. We have an open atmosphere that is great for learning and everyone is encouraged to ask for help and get input. You will work with skilled and talented engineers who want to make an impact. We often meet outside of work and do fun things together such as game nights, parties and outdoor activities.
Other perks and benefits
International working environment
Visa sponsorship and relocation package
Gym and fitness perks
Private health insurance
Work/life balance
Career development support
Parental leave and extra compensation
Competitive salary
Paid time off and flexible schedules

Equal Opportunity Employer


doWhile is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment at doWhile is based on merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability.

headline: Cloudutvecklare, Service och Devops
description.text:
Taekwondo-tränare, biodlare eller hobbyfiskare? Just nu söker vi en Cloudutvecklare med fler intressen än bara jobbet. Dina talanger och erfarenheter berikar. De bidrar till en större förståelse för människors vardag och den värld vi alla lever i samt gör CPAC Systems till en roligare arbetsplats att jobba på. När du, humleodlaren och filatelisten hamnar i möte med hemmasnickaren tar ni er an de kreativa utmaningarna på andra sätt än när ni bara har på er ingenjörshatten. Ni hittar smartare lösningar som gör livet lättare för våra kunder ute på deras arbetsplatser, inte bara ute i lastbilen, grävmaskinen, asfaltsläggaren, dumpern utan även för dem på sitekontoret.

Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens produkter när vi tar steget bortom maskinerna och skapar kraftfulla lösningar för både webben och mobila enheter? Alltsammans uppkopplat i real-tid baserat på vår egen cloud-lösning. Har du andra erfarenheter än de som syns på visitkortet eller examensbeviset?

Det här vill vi att du ska göra

Som Cloudutvecklare på CPAC får du jobba med de roligaste, men också de mest utmanande projekten inom vår bransch. Du arbetar tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i ett utvecklingsteam med fokus på att skapa framtidens produkter. Eftersom vi är ett produktbolag kommer du att vara med hela vägen från idé till färdig produkt. Kraven som ställs på användarvänlighet och värdeskapande funktioner är mycket höga vilket gör att samarbetet mellan kunder, utvecklare och provning är otroligt viktigt. Du arbetar tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i projektteamet med fokus på att verkligen göra skillnad för våra kunder.

Organisationen är platt och rättfram i en bransch där utvecklingen går mycket snabbt framåt, där du kommer att vara direkt involverad i det som händer.

Det här är du

Vi söker dig som tycker att cloudutveckling är bland det roligaste som finns. Då våra team jobbar brett med produkten och kundvärdet i fokus får du gärna även ha intresse för systemutveckling, testutveckling och allt annat som krävs för att sätta en framgångsrik produkt på marknaden. Du håller dig uppdaterad på vad som händer inom dina specialområden och delar med dig av din expertkunskap som vi tror du fått genom några års erfarenhet av att arbeta med:

- Azure DevOps, NestJS, NodeJS, NPM, ReactJS, TypeScript, SQL/databaser, Git, Linuxmiljöer, Kommunikation via http, websockets, REST, GRPC eller GraphQL

Det är även meriterande med erfarenhet inom:

- Golang, Java, SVN, Spring, Kotlin, Node, Kubernetes, Helm, AWS, Docker/Micro-services, Ingress, Ambassador, Javascript

Utöver intresse för just cloudutveckling är du en bra kollega och gillar kreativ friktion. Du tar dig tid att lyssna samtidigt som du gillar fart. Och såklart är du van vid att kommunicera på både på svenska och engelska.

Vi har en hybrid arbetsplats som innebär en kombination av att arbeta på kontoret och på distans vilket betyder att man bör kunna vara på kontoret flera dagar i veckan. I vår värld rekryterar vi personligheter. Känner du att det här är något för dig vill vi gärna veta vem du är. Skicka in din ansökan och har du frågor, kontakta Mathias Andreasson på mathias.andreasson@cpacsystems.se.

headline: DevOps Engineer to RLDatix
description.text:
Want to be a part of making healthcare safer and join a global company with people who are passionate about what they do? RLDatix are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join their team. Sounds interesting? Please continue reading!

What will you do?

We want to welcome you to a company that loves learning and developing. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be involved in the cloud journey and the handle of our Swedish Data. The field in which we operate moves fast and we move with it with curiosity and passion regarding how we can make people lives better.

You will be a part of our DevOps team and work closely with our developers whilst being our Cloud Native DevOps. You will join a learning culture and a team that enjoys sharing best practice and being innovative. We celebrate new ideas and individuality.

Who are you?

You would probably describe yourself as the operational one who is very interested in the technical side. The need and willingness to continually learn is in your core and working in a team with all that entails is a given for you.

We also believe you recognize yourself in the following:

- You are a cloud native and feel very comfortable in cloud services like AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform
- You have experience in scripted languages, preferably PowerShell, Bash or Python
- You speak both Swedish and English


Perhaps you also know some other parts of our tech stack:

- Jenkins
- Octopus
- Microsoft SQL
- PostgreSQL
- Mongo DB
- Kubernetes
- Docker


About us

We are a global team that is passionate about improving healthcare. We believe in what we do and truly want to make a difference in the lives of patients around the world.

We believe in a world where patients have access to quality care, where workforces are supported by transparency and empathy and where organizations are committed to an overall culture of safety.

Contact

In this recruitment, we are collaborating with Wise IT. If you want to know more, contact the responsible recruitment consultant Alexander Lindgren at alexander.lindgren@wiseit.se. Unfortunately, we cannot accept applications via email as we protect your privacy. You can read more about how we process personal data according to the GDPR in the Wise Group Group’s policy for the processing of personal data

Selection is ongoing, we welcome your application!

headline: Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer
description.text:
At Paradox, we are focused on bringing value to our community by creating groundbreaking features for both players and game developers. If you are a passionate Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer who would like to work at a successful games company, full of people passionate about technology and games, read on and learn how you can be part of the fun and talented Central Tech and Services (CTS) department!
Your adventure starts in the Infrastructure team to work on various development projects focused on delivering new and updated features for internal development teams, Paradox game studios, and our players. This also means that you will be working with projects related to the Paradox game development studios, as well as the publishing organization. You will also manage platform stability, features, and costs while assisting the development teams to guarantee we continue delivering Paradox’s signature experiences.
As an engineer within the Infrastructure team you will work with Paradox’s different platform environments, services and related infrastructure. Your day to day activities will include monitoring and maintaining our platform and cloud resources related to online services, as well as internal scripts and utilities shared within the department. This will also include maintaining the automated build and deployment pipeline (CI/CD). You will also support other teams with knowledge sharing as well as mentoring team members.
The skills we’re searching for…
5+ years of professional experience, preferably in a services/DevOps team
3+ years professional experience in cloud operational infrastructure and services
Professional experience working within one or more public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
Professional experience of Terraform and Kubernetes
Comfortable with a range of programming languages and technologies
Coding/scripting knowledge for automation of infrastructure
Experience with code versioning tools, such as Git or similar frameworks
Experience for mentoring other members of the team

You as a candidate:
We believe you are a service-minded, driven, and explorative individual. You have an eye for details and are comfortable with solving problems and working autonomously within a group. Your role in a team is flexible and can include being the one who identifies viable solutions and implements appropriate solutions, as well as mentor others. Your English communication skills, both written and verbal, are excellent and are backed by patience in taking the time to understand others as well as in explaining yourself.


Practical information:
Scope: Full time and permanent
Reports to: Cloud Operations Manager
Location: This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden

headline: DEVOPS ENGINEER - Stockholm
description.text:
Veritaz is a fast-growing IT-consultant firm. Our company is made up of insanely bright people from over 4 countries, and we are located in Sweden, UK, US and Pakistan. The voyage has been incredible this far, but it is only the beginning.
Assignment Description:
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer who is experienced in automation, and script languages including Bash and Python.
Do you value openness, transparency, and empowerment? Our squad is high performing cross-functional team who are set with a mission to provide win-win exchanges for our customer.
What you'll do:
●       Develop and maintain different CI/test framework solutions for software, enabling CI (Continuous Integration) on component and system level.
●       Develop HIL solutions and other CI framework solutions for automated testing within our environments.
●       Build tools to reduce occurrences of errors and improve customer experience and develop software to integrate with internal back-end systems.

●       Staying on top of industry best practices and trends, as well as changes to compliance requirements.
Who you are:

●       Experience with DevOps tools, processes, culture, distributed systems, and supporting mission-critical systems.
●       Excellent communication, teamwork skills, inter-personal and Organizational skills.

headline: DevOps Engineer - Observability
description.text:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, TV channels and production studios. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.

We may have started in the Nordics, but we have a global mindset and consider ourselves to be the international streaming challenger. This means we’re constantly launching our Viaplay streaming service in new markets and on the lookout for talented, curious, driven professionals to join us on our journey.

Right now, we’re searching for a DevOps Engineer within Observability to our Stockholm office - are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?

The role

You will be part of the Engineering team in the Technical Operations Center (TOC). Our mission is to build solutions and tooling that help Viaplay Group and the 24/7 Technical Operations Center strategically and in the daily work to reduce incident resolution time as well as proactively prevent them across our platform and services. Today eight skilled engineers and great team players with individual crafting specialties are running the show and we need you to strengthen us within Observability Engineering.

The TOC Engineering team has a broad area of responsibilities, and we currently have a set up with smaller focus groups, Tooling & Automation, Observability and Security. We are right now in need of someone that can drive and mainly work end-to-end with development and engineering within Observability.

You will have a key role in setting up infrastructure which enables our stakeholders to have insights in our platform’s capacity, health and performance. As part of our mission, you will support in promoting adoption of observability tooling. You will:

- Design and build an observability infrastructure across teams.

- Educate and lead efforts to improve observability across teams.

- Design and implement monitoring and alerting strategies to enforce application SLOs.

- Build tools and design processes that help improve observability and system resiliency.

- Set up dashboards, alerts, detectors that reflect the system's capacity to provide high quality and secure customer experience.

What we’re looking for

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:

- Working with observability tooling, such as OpenTelemetry, Vector, Prometheus, Jaeger, Grafana, ELK and/or Splunk.

- Development skills in languages such as Python.

- Infrastructure as code, such as Terraform and Troposphere/CloudFormation.

- Cloud infrastructure at scale with AWS using container orchestration, functions, roles, databases, queues and data streams (or other equivalent cloud experience).

- Experience with Linux internals, containers and shell scripting.

- Drawing architectural diagrams, guides and documentation to share across teams.

- Designing and implementing solutions end-to-end across teams.

- Solid experience with source code and binary repositories using git.

- Automated continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines using GitHub Actions or similar.

And you are a problem solver at heart who thrives in a collaborative environment. We also believe that you are a communicative individual.

It’s a bonus if you have:

- Development skills in languages such as Go and JavaScript

Our offering
- We’ve got the basics covered (and then some)! 30 days of paid vacation every year, flexible work arrangements and extra compensation on top of a parental pay lift.

- Your wellbeing matters. We have an attractive pension and insurance scheme with full healthcare coverage should you need it.

- A safe space to grow and up-skill with the freedom to try new things in autonomous teams. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development, while always making sure you feel supported with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical training, mentorship opportunities and peer-to-peer networks.

- An innovative environment with Hack Days, not once, but twice a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.

- A genuinely international and diverse group of colleagues to connect with. We’re striving towards a 50:50 gender balance & we’re not far off - plus last time we checked, we have more than 60 different nationalities across our nine offices!

- Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product - including live sports & pay per view events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.

Hit play today
If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here - you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page (https://careers.viaplaygroup.com/) or follow us on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/lifeatviaplaygroup/)! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

headline: Global Azure DevOps Specialist
description.text:
Epiroc is a leading productivity partner for the mining, infrastructure and natural resources industries. With
cutting-edge technology, Epiroc develops and produces innovative drill rigs, rock excavation and construction
equipment, and provides world-class service and consumables. The company was founded in Stockholm,
Sweden, and has passionate people supporting and collaborating with customers in more than 150 countries.
Learn more at www.epirocgroup.com.

Global Azure DevOps Specialist
Epiroc is currently seeking a driven Global Azure DevOps Specialist with a can-do attitude to be part of Epiroc IT.
As a Global Azure DevOps Specialist, you will:
  *  Be a part of Epiroc’s digital journey and enable hundreds of developers to be more productive. 
  *  Establish a global application governance of Azure DevOps and document Azure DevOps best practices.
  *  Facilitate regular meetings with key stakeholders and drive community of practice to capture, analyze, and implement new Azure DevOps requirements and ways of working.
Help the teams to secure the deliveries with:
- Static code analysis
- License scanning of third-party tools
- Secret scanning on code base
- GDPR scanning on code and work item data

  *  Continuously learn technical skills and knowledge, keep up to date with the market. 
  *  Be part of evaluating Epiroc future development platform like Microsoft Dev Box and other alternatives.
  *  Be our representative towards Microsoft in matters related to Azure DevOps. 


Your profile
As a person you are organized, independent and your work is influenced by structure. We believe you are customer-oriented, and service minded.
You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field combined with Azure certifications. A solid experience working with Azure DevOps is required. As a Global Azure DevOps Specialist, you need to be able to design and implement strategies for collaboration, code, infrastructure as code, security, compliance, continuous integration, testing, delivery, monitoring, and feedback.  Additionally, you have good understanding of Agile and Lean concepts and methodologies and good understanding on how to design, build, test, and maintain cloud applications and services in general.
As our corporate language is English, verbal, and written communication skills in English are required.

Life at Epiroc
By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We work in a global environment with over 113 different nationalities! 
In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, there are some things that makes us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc:  
  *  Global career opportunities
  *  Epiroc University, for your own competence development
  *  Community involvement
  *  Benefits package, which amongst other things include flexible working hours and bonus.

A hybrid workplace 
Life at Epiroc can include the possibility for a hybrid workplace. It is a way of working that offers flexibility and participation allowing for a better balance between work and private life, which also promotes well-being. The hybrid workplace is an opportunity if work allows, based on your role, responsibilities, and individual conditions.

Application and contact information
In this recruitment process, we review applications continuously. Welcome with your application as soon as possible by creating an account in our recruitment system. Last day to apply for this position is 2023-02-12. 
For questions about the position please contact hiring manager: Andreas Bülow, Enterprise Architecture & IT PMO Manager, andreas.bulow@epiroc.com
For questions about the recruitment process or application please contact: Recruitment specialists Jenny Flygare, jenny.flygare@se.experis.com or Luka Jovovic, luka.jovovic@se.experis.com.

headline: DevOps engineer to Elekta!
description.text:
Do you want to be a part of a Cloud journey? We are now looking for Elekta's new Linux System Administrator to their DevOps team in Stockholm. Elekta’s history and success has been built on people who turn today’s challenges into tomorrow’s solutions. The purpose of all the work they do at Elekta is to help clinicians improve patients’ lives. If you’re as passionate about humanity and innovation as Elekta are – apply below!

OM TJÄNSTEN 
As a leading innovator of precision radiation therapy solutions, Elekta is committed to ensuring that every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta's offering allows clinicians to treat more patients with increased quality, both with value-creating innovations in solutions and AI-supported service based on a global network.

We are looking for a Linux system administrator to join Elekta's DevOps team. The DevOps team is a service-oriented group of three that provides the engineering team of approximately 70 people with IT infrastructure, tools, and tool support for software development and continuous integration.

As a Linux System Administrator, you'll have the opportunity to:


* Be part of an inspiring company that's embarking on an exciting cloud journey.
* Work alongside other talented and senior professionals to shape the direction and success of this initiative
* Be part of a team that's making a real impact


With these opportunities, you'll be able to take your career to the next level!

This is a consulting assignment where you will be employed by Academic Work and work at Elekta with the possibility of being recruited by our client, provided a satisfying collaboration. As a consultant for Academic Work, we offer great opportunities for you to grow professionally, build your network, and create valuable contacts for the future. Read more here!

ARBETSUPPGIFTER 
As a member of the DevOps team, you will work on a wide range of tasks with a focus on Linux administration, infrastructure automation for provisioning of virtual machines and containers both on-premises and in the cloud, networking and security, and proactive monitoring and maintenance of infrastructure on-premises and in Azure. Today, the team uses tools such as Jenkins, GIT, Subversion, Artifactory, and Prometheus.

Elekta follows an agile methodology (SAFe), and you will be part of a scrum team. You will interact frequently with your team members as well as other development teams and the IT organization.

VI SÖKER DIG SOM 
To be a suitable candidate for this position, we think you are an experienced Linux System Administrator or Software Engineer with DevOps experience. We believe you have a relevant university degree, such as in computer science, or extensive experience. In terms of language, you possess a proficient level of English that is suitable for business purposes. This is because English is the primary language used for communication at Elekta.

We think you have earlier experience in one or more of the following areas:


* Linux system administration
* Automation of server provisioning and maintenance (i.e. SaltStack or Ansible)
* Virtualization and container technology (KVM, Docker, etc.)
* Good working knowledge in scripting languages such as Python, bash
* Network configuration


Knowledge or experience in the following areas is a merit:


* Standard tools and technology for DevOps (i.e. SCM, CI/CD Pipelines)
* Cloud solutions (i.e. Azure)
* Agile ways of working (Scrum, Kanban and/or SAFe)


We will focus on the following behaviors during the recruitment process:


* Problem solver
* Self-sufficient
* Communicative


Other information


* Start date: As soon as possible
* Extent: Full time
* Location: Central Stockholm, Sweden


The recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and Elekta's wish is that all questions regarding the position are handled by Academic Work.

We go through the selection process on an ongoing basis, and the advertisement can be closed before the position is filled if we have moved on to the selection and interview phases.

headline: DevOps Engineer - Python
description.text:
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer with Telecom domain knowledge.

Do you want to be a part of an exciting company while being in charge of your own future?

Go on and apply today!

Competencies required:
- Experience ( 3 years) within SW development or test in embedded systems

- Ubuntu Linux / Red Hat Linux

- Docker / Kubernetes / Docker Swarm

- Microservices

About Insert Talent

At Insert Talent, we believe in the power of meaning and putting your talents to the best possible use. We help professionals find the place where they can make a difference, where a clear direction and diversity in perspectives and skills helps the individual contribute to a larger whole.

headline: DevOps Engineer - 378721
description.text:
Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, trams, and e-buses to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide.
 
Are you looking for a new challenge and want to bring new green solutions to the world market? If you are driven by product development and believes that your team members are your most important assets, then we would like to get to know you! 
 
Join us as a DevOps Engineer based in Gothenburg, Sweden 
 
 
Your mission?
 
 As DevOps Engineer you will support the project delivery team. You will have the accountability for creation, maintenance, and evolution of software development/test infrastructure.
 
Your key responsibilities?
Development and maintenance of Linux based infrastructure.
Implementation of CI/CD pipelines
Maintenance and development of current solutions
Internal processes automation
Supervision over development environments
Help with code failures analysis.
Close cooperation with test and development team
Solving problems on test and dev environments
Creation and maintenance of tech documentation

 
Minimum qualifications:
Engineering degree and/or master’s degree preferable of Science in Engineering
Understanding of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) processes
Knowledge of Linux operating systems and administration
Comfort to administer Linux OS (CentOS, Ubuntu)
Experience with configuration management tool (Ansible)
Proficiency in at least one of the following scripting languages: Python, Bash, Groovy
Expertise in Docker, knowledge of how to build, operate and deploy Docker containers.
Experience with CI/CD tools configuration (Jenkins, Git)
Knowledgeable in network, firewall and security best practices
Broad knowledge of IT infrastructure automation in general
Advanced written and spoken English.

 
Ideally:
Experience in C code development
Familiar with Docker Swarm
RPM packages creation
Knowledge about Solaris
Experience with monitoring tools (Grafana)
Familiar with WSL

 
 
 
Why Alstom? 
Alstom is the leading company in the railway sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive, and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose? 
 
Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

headline: DevOps Engineer to Prorenata!
description.text:
Prorenata is looking for a driven (dev)OPS Engineer

We at Prorenata are building an operational system for student health. That's the boring version. What we're really trying to do is provide useful, simple, fun tools for our users who otherwise often are stuck with hard-to-use, outdated systems. We enjoy helping people, and this shows in our support where customer satisfaction is very high.

We are a growing company, today we are about 35 people, but we have the privilege of having a large influx of customers and we want to take care of those customers. Now we're looking for a (dev)OPS Engineer , and that's where you come into the picture.

Are you curious about why we write (dev)OPS? Let us tell you:

In this role, there will be more focus on operations than development. Which is why we are looking for you who is in love with the operations part of (dev)OPS. You will be a part of our DevOps team together with other colleagues.

Your job will consist of monitoring, managing terraform, managing alarms, and being an important part when it comes to the structural security of our systems. In addition to this, you must enjoy dealing with the unexpected tasks that arise during the day and leaning towards the operational side of the job which will contribute to helping us keep the system in good condition.

Who are you?
We believe that you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, especially with cloud solutions. We are looking for people who are curious, organized and have a genuine interest in operations and databases. This role requires you to be fluent in English and it is a plus if you know Swedish as well.

These are some of the technologies, frameworks and services that we use:

- Kubernetes/Docker
- OpenStack or Cloud
- Operations of IT systems (availability, logging, monitoring, security)
- GitHub
- Helm
- Python scripting
- Database administration (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
- Terraform
- CI/CD pipelines


What we offer:

We offer an exciting work environment in a lovely office at Skeppsbron in Gamla Stan. Our workplace is characterised by a friendly atmosphere with colleagues who take care of each other. Our current hybrid model offers the possibility to work both in the office and remotely, since our teams work in an agile way, they are jointly responsible for the presence in the office.

Apply today!

Interviews are ongoing, so submit your application today. If you have any questions, contact me on sandra.wikstrom@prorenata.se

headline: Utbildningsradion söker en DevOps
description.text:
Utbildningsradion (UR) genomgår en spännande digital transformation och söker nu en DevOps som vill bidra till något större och växa tillsammans med oss!      

Vad vi erbjuder dig      UR drivs av att ge alla frihet genom kunskap och är en motkraft mot ökade kunskapsklyftor. Som public service-bolag identifierar UR självständigt kunskapsbehov och skapar ett utbud för att möta dem. Ibland rör det sig om ett riktat behov till en begränsad grupp, ibland om ett brett behov hos hela befolkningen. UR finns till för alla som vill ha mer kunskap - både till de många och de få.     
Hos oss får du möjlighet att göra skillnad på riktigt och bidra till utvecklingen av våra streamingtjänster, både för vardags- och klassrum. Genom miljontals årliga starter bidrar vi till lärande och kunskap som finns tillgängliga genom våra egna såväl som på tredjepartsplattformar. Vi publicerar på vår egen tjänst UR Play och sänder i SVT:s och Sveriges Radios kanaler.  
Vi har ett unikt kunskapsuppdrag vilket ställer särskilda krav. Genom att förena journalistik och pedagogik skapar vi program som hjälper människor till ny och bestående kunskap. Vi kallar det för upplevelser som förändrar.      
För att privatlivet och arbetslivet ska gå smidigare erbjuder vi möjlighet att arbeta på distans om så önskas enligt en 50/50-regel.  
Det här får du göra hos oss  I rollen som DevOps hos oss kommer du att ingå i vår infrastruktur-avdelning som idag består av 10 medarbetare, vilket är systemutvecklare, systemarkitekt, systemansvariga samt drift- och supporttekniker. Närmast kommer du arbeta med vår systemarkitekt och våra systemutvecklare men du kommer också arbeta brett inom hela organisationen. Du kommer vara en drivande del i arbetet att bygga upp och etablera en DevOps-kultur hos oss och din tyngd kommer ligga i Ops-delen med Monitor, Deploy och Release.

Tillsammans med kollegor kommer du vara med och sätta upp samt underhålla IT-infrastrukturen för UR:s digitala tjänster, arbeta med installation och underhåll av operativsystem och mjukvara för både in-house utvecklade- och externt utvecklade system. Tillsammans med ditt team kommer du att: 
* Sätta upp och underhålla olika delar i vår IT-infrastruktur som front proxies, HTTP Cache, webbservrar, Java-baserade stand-alone applikationer, meddelandeköer och gästoperativsystem (Linux) i VMware. 
* Avlasta systemutvecklarna genom att fungera som avancerad first line support och stödja den övriga verksamheten med felsökning och liknande. 
* Skapa och underhålla Amazon Machine Images (AMI:s) på Amazon EC2. 
* Bygga upp system för IT-automation och konfiguration mha. t.ex. Ansible. 
* Vara med och bygga upp system för automatisk övervakning av delsystem till UR:s plattformar inom programproduktion, broadcasting, podcast, streaming och metadata. 


Vem är du?  Vi söker dig som är noggrann, nyfiken och ser lösningar istället för problem. Du bör uppskatta samarbete likväl som du kan agera själv och ta initiativ. En öppenhet för att ta till sig och vilja lära sig nytt samtidigt som du kan komma med egna förslag och idéer är en förutsättning för att växa i rollen. För att lyckas bra i rollen behöver du en bred erfarenhet av intern infrastruktur och en eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes är det meriterande.  
 Övrigt     Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande så se till att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare på catrin.fraghstedt@ur.se. Fackliga upplysningar lämnas av Thomas Boström (SACO), John Naeslund (Unionen) och Eva Blomberg (SJF). Samtliga nås via UR:s växel 08-784 40 00.  

Välkommen med din ansökan!

headline: Aurora Innovation rekryterar DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Vill du hjälpa hälso- och sjukvården bli världsledande inom digitalisering? Vill du vara med i utvecklingen av en marknadsledande produkt? Då är detta tjänsten för dig.

Aurora Innovation växer och rekryterar ytterligare en  DevOps Engineer med erfarenhet av systemutveckling och DevOps i ett Saas-bolag. 

Aurora Innovation erbjuder dig en chans att ta plats i en organisation som genomgår en spännande förvandling med ny teknik och utökade samarbetsytor, där verksamheten värdesätter trivsel på arbetsplatsen tillsammans med en öppen och ärlig atmosfär. Hos Aurora Innovation blir du en del av ett starkt team med fantastiska kollegor. Organisationen är engagerad och motiverad och står inför flera spännande utmaningar.

Tjänsten är placerad på Aurora Innovations huvudkontor i Uppsala. Du förväntas vara ungefär 2-3 dagar i veckan på plats på kontoret.

Detta är en direkt rekrytering av Aurora Innovation där vi på Poolia har fått möjlighet att hjälpa till i rekryteringsprocessen. Urvalet sker löpande så ta chansen att bli Aurora Innovations nästa kollega redan idag.

Om tjänsten
Aurora Innovation genomgår en ambitiös systemtransition med fokus på containerisering och snabbare, automatiserade deployments. Därav söker verksamheten ytterligare en driven DevOps Engineer för att förstärka plattformsteamet som består av fyra personer, med bakgrund inom utveckling och DevOps. Teamet spelar en central roll i systemtransitionen och ansvarar för att leverera relevanta, säkra och effektiva plattformar till utvecklingsteamen. Med din samlade erfarenhet blir du en viktig del i arbetet mot ett fullt ägarskap av deployment pipelines, automatisering och övervakning av Aurora Innovations plattformar.

I tjänsten ingår beredskap på kvällstid, ca var sjätte vecka. 


Vem är du?
Vi söker dig som har en bakgrund inom systemutveckling, brinner för DevOps och plattformslösningar som hjälper utvecklingsteamen att leverera bättre produkter på kortare tid. Du har ett intresse av informationssäkerhet och gärna erfarenhet från säkerhetsverktyg och sårbarhetsanalys. Aurora Innovation arbetar aktivt mot ISO27001-certifiering. Du är van att arbeta med verksamhetskritiska lösningar.

Vi ser även att du har kunskaper och erfarenheter inom de flesta av dessa områden:
•	Systemutveckling; Python, Go, Java
•	Containers; Docker, Kubernetes
•	Automation och CI/CD
•	Agila principer
•	Informationssäkerhet och analysverktyg
•	Infrastructure as Code; Terraform, Ansible
•	Övervakning och metrics
•	Molnplattformar; AWS, GCP
•	Nätverk
•	Telefoni

Som person värdesätter du samarbete teamöverskridande för att förstå behov och driva förändringar med fokus på skalbarhet, prestanda, säkerhet och kostnad. Din positiva attityd och engagemang bygger förtroende över teamgränser. Du är en riktig teamplayer och uppfattas som serviceinriktad. Vidare så tar ansvar för dina uppgifter och du uppfattas som driven. Du har förmåga att skapa goda relationer och kommunicerar tydligt och förtroendeingivande på alla nivåer i organisationen.
Din erfarenhet och expertis ger tydligt mervärde i teamet samtidigt som du ser fram emot att lära dig mer och fortsätta utvecklas tillsammans med teamet.

Om verksamheten
Aurora Innovation hjälper vårdgivare och organisationer att öka tillgängligheten och underlätta kontakten mellan människor. Vi utvecklar och erbjuder kommunikationslösningen Aurora TeleQ. Företaget grundades 1996 i Uppsala och har en stabil och bra tillväxt. Idag är vi ca 100 anställda och omsätter ca 150 miljoner. Vi har huvudkontor i nybyggda Magasin X vid centralstationen i Uppsala. Övriga kontor finns i Finland, Nederländerna och Spanien. Våra kunder runt om i Europa hanterar ca 10 miljoner ärenden i månaden i våra system och vi arbetar aktivt med att bredda vår marknad.
